1.title: Women In Uniform
1.plot: After a dodgy 'audition,' Evie Stevens (Belinda Kirwan) and Lucy Lew (Nina Nicols) visit their agent Cha Cha Rogers (Abbe Holmes) and beg her to help them get a break. This leads to a life-changing audition with Entertainment Industry heavyweight Casting Director Kiki Kramer (Jo Stanley). Luckily, the girls' latest soul-destroying casual job at 'Cherry's Carwash' comes with some perks thanks to their new boss Peppe De Luca (Chris Fortuna).

2.title: Sweet Cherry Pie
2.plot: Lucy (Nina Nicols) and Evie (Belinda Kirwan) learn more about Peppe (Chris Fortuna) and his creative business practices and the girls' best mate and Live-in-Landlord Tommy McFarlane (Dave O'Neil) attempts to continue working professionally as a musician at a brand new venue.

3.title: Cats On a Hot Tin Roof
3.plot: Evie (Belinda Kirwan) and Lucy (Nina Nicols) decide to risk it all to save their reputations and rope Tommy (Dave O'Neil) into helping them. Tommy endures more 'Morning Melodies' hell and the trio discovers that the casting couch really does exist.

4.title: Love You Long Time
4.plot: After blowing their entire weekly wage on a little retail therapy, Evie (Belinda Kirwan) rekindles her tumultuous relationship with the jet-setting enigmatic Television Producer Chad Morrison (Lawrence Mooney) and Lucy learns that Hans De Kretser (MARK COLES SMITH) is not only a Radical Marxist freedom fighter but also a talented beat poet.

5.title: Bark, Baby!Bark!
5.plot: Upon their agent - Cha Cha's (Abbe Holmes) request, Evie (Belinda Kirwan) and Lucy (Nina Nicols) get new headshots with Auteur photographer Louie McGregor (Paul Ireland). Tommy (Dave O'Neil) keeps secretly making ends meet at the RSL and Cha Cha shares some shocking news with the girls.

6.title: Girls on Film
6.plot: After a hard day's work at 'Cherry's Carwash,' Peppe (Chris Fortuna) invites Lucy (Nina Nicols) and Evie (Belinda Kirwan) back to his place for dinner. The girls and Peppe get to know each other a whole lot better and Peppe makes them a lucrative entertainment industry deal that the girls find difficult to refuse........or not.

imdb.plot outline: 'HACTRESSES' is a wacked 6-part comedy web series about Evie and Lucy, two naive best friends who ambitiously strive to achieve one big dream: to become successful actresses before they hit thirty. Despite years of failed auditions, demeaning jobs and unscrupulous bosses, abject poverty, failed relationships and very little progress, their dream (or is it a delusion???) never dies.

Despite years of failed auditions, demeaning jobs and unscrupulous bosses, abject poverty, failed relationships and very little progress, their dream (or is it a delusion???) never dies.::Belinda Kirwan - Nina Nicols

_HActresses_ (qv) is a wacked 6-part comedy web series about EVIE STEVENS and LUCY LEW, two naive best friends who ambitiously strive to achieve one impossible dream: to become successful professional actresses before they hit thirty. Despite years of failed auditions, co-op theatre and independent films, demeaning jobs, unscrupulous bosses, abject poverty, dysfunctional relationships and very little progress, their dream (or is it a delusion?) never dies. EVIE and LUCY share a house, a life and a dream together. But their only real current performing work is uploading acting scenes and Vlogs onto their YouTube channel with the assistance of their live-in-Landlord and long-suffering friend, financial backstop and washed-up musician TOMMY MCFARLANE. In their desperation, they attempt to court the favour of their hack agent as well as producers, directors and casting directors. Instead, they just receive propositions from users, losers, phonies and big-time nobodies. Although their lack of success may dampen their spirits at times, it definitely hasn't extinguished the flame that has burnt brightly within them since they graduated from drama school. Naively, the girls believe that their boss PEPPE DE LUCA may facilitate some opportunities for introductions, meetings and auditions. But after visiting his house, it becomes patently obvious that the favours that Peppe promises come at a very high cost. The girls' love lives with their boyfriends are not much better. '_HActresses_ (qv)' posits the question: Just how far do young actresses have to go to advance their career? In the wake of the horrific revelations about Harvey Weinstein, associates and other industry powerbrokers, this aspect of the _HActresses_ (qv) storyline is timely and unfortunately all too familiar.
